珰字的基本解释

珰
（璫）
dāng
古代妇女戴在耳垂上的装饰品。
中国汉代武职宦官帽子的装饰品，后借指宦官。
屋椽头的装饰，即“瓦当”。

珰字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dāng］
［《廣韻》都郎切，平唐，端。］
“珰1”的繁体字。
(1)古代妇女的耳饰。
(2)借指宦官。汉代宦官充武职者，其冠用璫和貂尾为饰，故后代用称宦官。
(3)瓦当。屋椽头的装饰。
(4)见“璫琅”、“璫璫”。
(5)见“琅璫”。

珰字的康熙字典解释
珰字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
珰字的起名意思

指古代妇女戴在耳垂上的装饰品，如以金玉制成环，玉制的耳饰。

珰
Basic explanation of words
珰
(珰)
dāng
Ornaments worn on earlobes by ancient women.
The decoration of the hat of the military eunuch in the Han Dynasty in China, and later referred to the eunuch.
The decoration of the rafters of the house is called "Wadang".
珰
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dāng］
["Guangyun" Du Langqie, Ping Tang, Duan. ]
Traditional characters for "珰1".
(1) Earrings of ancient women.
(2) By referring to the eunuch. The eunuchs in the Han dynasty were appointed as military officials, and their crowns were decorated with 珰 and sable tails, so their descendants were called eunuchs.
(3) Wadang. Decoration of house rafters.
(4) See "珰lang", "珰珰".
(5) See "Langyan".
珰

珰
Source glyph
Font comparison: Song Ti, Mainland China
Taiwan Minutes
Korean Ming Dynasty
珰
Name meaning
Refers to the ornaments worn on the earlobes by ancient women, such as rings made of gold and jade, and earrings made of jade.
dāng
1) жемчужные серьги; подвески (на головном уборе)
2) жемчужина; жемчуг
